author: potuz
content:
<@206016661470314496> I remember one of the things you complained about Gnark is that it would paralellize verification and not let you control it. I don't think I remember you mentioning this from BLST, but just in case, this is the same there although  you can set the GOMAXPROCS at least
```
        numCores := runtime.GOMAXPROCS(0)
        numThreads := maxProcs
        if numThreads > numCores {
                numThreads = numCores
        }
        if numThreads > n {
                numThreads = n
        }
```

author: _shemnon
content: That's my understanding.  Warming brings the current state into memory, but does not necessarily imply updates.  So we track warmed and touched accounts separately.  Touched should always be a subset of warmed. however.
